data.text:
A significant proportion of businesses in Nigeria are helmed by young individuals, with 89% of surveyed businesses led by entrepreneurs under the age of 40. This marks a notable increase from 2022, when 81% of businesses were operated by young entrepreneurs. This trend underscores the growing prominence of young Nigerians in the entrepreneurial landscape. Their dynamism and fresh perspectives are fueling business growth and innovation across the country. To gain more insight about growing youth-led businesses, download the SOE 2023 report at https://lnkd.in/dxp8yFiR #FATEInstitute #soe2023 #youngentrepreneur

‚ôªÔ∏èWho We Are: At Pakistan Entrepreneur Hub (PEH), we are a community-driven platform dedicated to empowering Pakistani entrepreneurs across the globe. ‚ôªÔ∏èWhat We Do: ---Comprehensive Training: Providing top-notch training programs to equip you with essential business skills. ---Networking Opportunities: Facilitating connections with fellow entrepreneurs, mentors, and industry experts. ---Business Support: Offering resources, tools, and support tailored to your entrepreneurial journey. ---Success Stories: Showcasing the achievements of our members to inspire and motivate others. ‚ôªÔ∏èWhere You Can Find Us: Our reach extends globally through our robust online presence and active social media channels. ---Connect with us through our website, LinkedIn, Instagram, and other social platforms. ‚úÖWhy You Should Consider Us: üëâHalal Income Opportunities: Align your earnings with your values. üëâSupportive Community: Join a network of like-minded individuals who encourage growth and innovation. üëâProven Success: Leverage our reliable and established business model to achieve financial independence. üëâPersonal Growth: Develop both personally and professionally with our tailored programs and resources. Join us at PEH and take the first step towards transforming your business dreams into reality. Let‚Äôs work together to build a brighter future, one entrepreneur at a time! üöÄ #Entrepreneurship #PakistaniEntrepreneurs #BusinessGrowth #Innovation #Networking #PakistanEntrepreneurHub #irumjadoon

Moving abroad as a young entrepreneur can be exciting and overwhelming. But keeping your small business thriving in Nigeria after such a move takes careful planning. To keep growing, you‚Äôll need to adjust to the local business scene, use digital tools effectively, and build strong local connections. Here are six practical tips to help young Nigerians sustain their small businesses in Nigeria after moving back home. To sum up, keeping a small business going in Nigeria after moving abroad takes resilience, flexibility, and smart planning. By implementing these strategies, young Nigerian entrepreneurs can navigate Nigeria‚Äôs business scene like a pro and succeed long-term. With these tips, you can confidently keep running and growing your small business in Nigeria. #Entrepreneurship #SmallBusiness #NigerianBusiness #YoungEntrepreneurs #BusinessGrowth #Resilience #DigitalTools #LocalConnections

The entrepreneurial journey can be daunting, especially for seed stage and early stage Nigerian entrepreneurs. Our training program prepares them for the challenges ahead, teaching them how to overcome obstacles, adapt to market changes, and seize opportunities. Together, we can support the growth of a resilient and thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem in Nigeria. Join us! #EntrepreneurshipTraining #NigerianEntrepreneurs #BusinessGrowth

Meet Johnney Kusi Baffour, one of our dedicated enumerators from the Central Region. He shares insights from his engagement with over 100 respondents, highlighting the challenges faced by entrepreneurs in the region. Stay tuned as we continue to share inspiring journeys from our enumerators who are advocating for entrepreneurial freedom to foster a thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem in Ghana. #ACEYE #AtlasNetwork #regionalentrepreneurshipfreedomindex #REFIndex #freemarket #AfricaDevelopment #Africanprosperity #privatesector #Ghana #aceyeat5 #ilapi

"West Asia is a very neglected part of Asia. We don't tend to see it as being part of the larger Asian story..." Why is AVPN's Global Conference being held this year in Abu Dhabi? Ahead of this week's event, which anticipates hosting 1,500 delegates from more than 40 countries, AVPN's CEO Naina Subberwal Batra took some time out to speak to our editor Julie Pybus about why the conference has come to the UAE for the first time, what she hopes it will achieve, and how AVPN aims to help social entrepreneurs get the funding they really need ... #AVPN2024 #OneAsiaOneFuture #ImpactInvesting #SocialImpact
